Description: Solid-cast copper alloy falcon-headed harpoon-amulet; associated to Horus (?); small hole due to corrosion, at the base of the amulet; suspension loop probably lost; almost complete, heavily corroded.
Curator's comments: The harpoon "represents the weapon carried by Horus of Edfu" and this amulet is characteristic of the Late and Ptolemaic periods (Andrews 1994, 79-80, fig. 80; Late Period in Andrews 1994 covers Late and Ptolemaic periods, while Late dynastic is equated with Egyptian Late Period). Andrews, C. 1994, Amulets of Ancient Egypt, London.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (MB.209) (phase 3)
